problem_text:
A system of additive subgroups σij, 1 ⩽ i, j ⩽ n, of a field K is called a net (or a carpet) of order n if σirσrj ⊂ σij for all i, r, j. A net that does not contain the diagonal is called an elementary net. A net σ = (σij) is said to be irreducible if all σij are nontrivial. An elementary net σ is said to be closed if the elementary net subgroup E(σ) does not contain additional elementary transvections.
Let R be a principal ideals domain with 1 ∈ R, let k be the field of fractions of R, and K an algebraic extension of the field k. Let σ = (σij) be an irreducible elementary net σ = (σij) over K such that all σij are R-modules. Is the net σ closed?
V. A. Ko˘ıbaev
